newsitem.title: FINLAND: NORDIC ALUMINIUM SEES WEAKER JAN-APR SALES, PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: NORDIC ALUMINIUM SEES WEAKER JAN-APR SALES, PROFIT.

text.p: Finnish aluminium components maker Nordic Aluminiumn Oy said in a statement on Tuesday it expected net sales and operating profit to fall in the first tertial on the year-ago period, but the outlook was positive.

"We expect that net sales in the first tertial of 1997 will be slightly lower than in the corresponding period in 1996," it said. "The first tertial operating profit is also expected to be slightly lower," it added.
"The management of Nordic Aluminium is at the moment expecting that the general market environment for its products will be favourable during the rest of 1997," it said.
The company said the outlook was positive, "although there cannot be certainty about full-year 1997 net sales and operating profit."
On Monday, Nordic Aluminium announced its intention to broaden its ownership by issuing new shares and seek a bourse listing. The subscription price would be released on April 9, it said.
